Job Title: Brand Innovation Manager

Location: Springdale, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Job Details:

SUMMARY: 

The Manager, BU Innovation is responsible for management of the business activities related to innovation and has total responsibility to deliver an innovation pipeline for the brands/categories they are assigned. This role develops long and short-term strategies, new product and package ideas, and go-to-market approaches that will achieve corporate growth through innovation and deliver on profit, volume, and share objectives. The role also directs the activities of innovation and consulting agencies as appropriate.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Develop and implement the innovation pipeline and innovation strategies feeding the long range and annual plans for assigned categories, reflecting overall corporate and business unit goals.Lead development and execution of product and packaging innovation projects including concept development, feasibility validation, product and packaging R&D, business proposal and approval, project execution, customer sell in and tracking of in-market performance.Work in our innovation project management, packaging and specification systems to advance projects with the cross functional team.Act as liaison with all other corporate functions to ensure business initiatives receive necessary focus.Creatively identify opportunity areas for growth by effectively using syndicated research and trend data, primary market research and competitive intelligence.Develop meaningful consumer positioning for all innovation product lines that creates added value versus competitive and effectively communicate product advantages to consumers.Work collaboratively with insights, R&D, Channel Marketing and the BU to identify new ideas, build research and development plans, screen ideas and food and optimize our innovation offerings to meet consumer/operator needs and have a clear POD vs. our competitorsWork hand-in-hand with the sales and channel marketing organization to understand and integrate operator and/or distributor strategies into innovation pipeline. Proactively work with these partners on innovation forecast accuracy, maximization of opportunities and development of plans to deliver against JBP objectives.Direct innovation agencies and other suppliers in the development and implementation of marketing strategies and programs.Manage direct report(s), if applicable, training on innovation process and overseeing projects they own to ensure they stay on time and on track, and any issues that arise are resolved successfully.    

REQUIREMENTS:

Education: Bachelor’s Degree required

Experience: Minimum 3 years direct Product Innovation or Marketing experience

Communication Skills: Strong communication and presentation skills are required

Special Skills: Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of marketing and P&Ls, demonstrated strength in strategic thinking with a consumer lens is required, demonstrated strong analytical skills are required, strong collaborator with a demonstrated ability to lead cross functional teams, Proven ability to effectively manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment is required

Supervisory: Experience managing direct reports preferred, but not required

LOCATION: This role will be based onsite at our World Headquarters in Springdale, AR. Relocation assistance available for those who qualify.

Sponsorship is not available for this role.

Relocation Assistance Eligible:

Yes

Work Shift: 

1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Hourly Applicants ONLY -You must complete the task after submitting your application to provide additional information to be considered for employment.

Tyson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, age, genetics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

We provide our team members and their families with paid time off; 401(k) plans; affordable health, life, dental, vision and prescription drug benefits; and more.

CCPA Notice. If you are a California resident, and would like to learn more about what categories of personal information we collect when you apply for this job, and how we may use that information, please read our CCPA Job Applicant Notice at Collection, click here.

Experience Level (if available): None
